head: Chapter 1: Introduction
content: Chapter 1: Introduction This is the first chapter of our sample TEI document. It demonstrates how TEI XML can be used to encode literary and scholarly texts with rich metadata and structural markup. TEI (Text Encoding Initiative) provides a comprehensive framework for digital text encoding that preserves both the content and structure of documents. "The best way to understand TEI is to see it in action."

head: Chapter 2: Features
content: Chapter 2: Features This chapter showcases various TEI features supported by our reader: Hierarchical document structure Rich text formatting with bold and italic text Quotations and citations Poetry and verse structures Here is a sample poem line, To show how verse appears. Each line is properly encoded, As TEI text engineering.

head: Chapter 3: Conclusion
content: Chapter 3: Conclusion This sample document demonstrates the power of TEI XML for digital text representation. The reader application can parse this structure and present it in a user-friendly format. Features like table of contents generation, search functionality, and responsive reading interfaces make digital texts more accessible to modern readers.
